CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: PzNDTDTBT showed a sharp diffraction peak at 2θ = 21.4 ° and two weak peaks at 23.8 ° and 26.6 ° for the as-prepared thin film.

Let's think step by step.
1. Identify the acronym "PzNDTDTBT" as a single Material Name entity. It represents the name of the material used to prepare the thin film.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: PzNDTDTBT showed a sharp diffraction peak at 2θ = 21.4 ° and two weak peaks at 23.8 ° and 26.6 ° for the as-prepared thin film.

Let's think step by step.

1. PzNDTDTBT: This is the name of the thin film material. It can be considered as a single "Property Name" entity.
2. 2θ: This is the property name for the angle of measurement in X-ray diffraction analysis.
3. 21.4 °, 23.8 °, 26.6 °: These are the specific values of the property "2θ angle" for the diffraction peaks observed in the thin film. Each value can be considered as a separate "Property Value" entity, but for the purpose of identifying "Property Name" entities in this paragraph, they are considered as parts of the "Property Name" entity "2θ angle" since they describe the property and not the property name itself.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

1. PzNDTDTBT: This is the name of the material.
2. 2θ angle: This is the property name for the angle of measurement in X-ray diffraction analysis.
3. 21.4 °, 23.8 °, 26.6 °: These are the specific values of the property "2θ angle" for the diffraction peaks observed in the thin film.

So, the relevant entities for material properties are:

1. PzNDTDTBT
2. 2θ angle and its values 21.4 °, 23.8 °, 26.6 °.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| PzNDTDTBT (thin film material) |
| 2θ angle |

| Specific values of 2θ angle for diffraction peaks |
| --- |
| 21.4 ° |
| 23.8 ° |
| 26.6 ° |

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: PzNDTDTBT showed a sharp diffraction peak at 2θ = 21.4 ° and two weak peaks at 23.8 ° and 26.6 ° for the as-prepared thin film.

Let's think step by step.

1. PzNDTDTBT: This is the name of the thin film material. It is not a property value, but rather a material identifier.
2. 2θ: This is the property value being measured in the diffraction experiment. It represents the angle between the incident X-ray beam and the diffracted X-ray beam in the plane of the diffractometer's detector. The values given (21.4 °, 23.8 °, and 26.6 °) are specific property values for this particular thin film sample.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

The following entities in the paragraph refer to the values of material properties:

1. 21.4 °
2. 23.8 °
3. 26.6 °

These values represent the angles (2θ) in the diffraction experiment for the as-prepared thin film sample of PzNDTDTBT.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.
